item.title: New Blog on Learnings during reasearch published on Medium !
item.description: The new blog on the topic Riding the Noisy Research Track by Jitesh Jain is now published on Medium. In this blog, one of our members shares his experience and learnings in research, and covers some essential guidelines for a beginner in this field. Do give the blog a read here.

item.title: New Blog on Researching as an Undergrad Published on Medium !
item.description: The new blog on the topic What doing research as an undergrad can teach you. by Ayush Mangal is now published on Medium. The Blog talks about the writer’s experience as a undergrad researcher with the hope that this article might motivate more people to give research a shot even if they don’t want to become a scientist and remove the stigma surrounding research from their mind. Do give the blog a read here.

item.title: New Blog on Optimizers Published on Medium !
item.description: The new blog on the topic Optimizer: diving deep into Neural Networks by Rohan Garg is now published on Medium. The Blog covers the basics of the topic and the mathematical fundamentals followed in subject matter. Do give the blog a read here.

item.title: Workshops 2021
item.description:
We conducted a two day workshop covering:

  • Basics of CNNs and Pytorch on 25th March, 2021

  • Generative Modelling using GANs on 26th March, 2021

You can find the recordings on Google Drive.

For the colab notebooks and other instructions, please check out the Official Repo on GitHub.

item.title: New Blog on Metric Learning Published on Medium !
item.description: The new blog on the topic Metric Learning: It’s all about the Distance by Keerat Kaur Guliani is now published on Medium. The Blog covers the basics of the topic and the common notations followed in subject matter and some of the recent work in this field. Along with this, the blog is supplemented with animations using Manim Engine to further bring forward the main crux of the subject. Do give the blog a read here.

item.title: Preprint out for the paper: DEAP Cache: Deep Eviction Admission and Prefetching for Cache !
item.description:
In this paper, we propose a DL based approach to tackle the problem of Cache Replacement. This is the first time an approach has tried learning all the three policies: Admission, Prefetching and Eviction. Unlike, previous methods which relied on past statistics for carrying out cache replacement, we predict future statistics (frequency and recency) and then use an online RL-algorithm for eviction.

Checkout the preprint here.

item.title: The Basic and Advanced Discussions for the Autumn Semester (2020-21) restart !
item.description: The Basic and Advanced for the new semester begins. We have some really exciting topics lined up to be discussed. With the current pandemic, all the discussions will be online. Just as always, two discussions(Basic and Advanced) will be held every week. We are looking forward to new faces joining in the open discussions. You can also view the discussion schedule and other resources here.

item.title: Talk with Alumni: A Talk with Shagun Sodhani
item.description: The core members of the group had a very informative talk and discussion with our alumnus, Shagun Sodhani (Profile). He is currently a research engineer at FAIR and was one of the co-founders of ACM, IIT Roorkee Chapter. He shared experiences of his undergrad years, and also some of the crucial advice to our current members.

item.title: Preprint out for the paper: Universal Adversarial Perturbations: A Survey !
item.description:
The new survey paper on the topic of Universal Adversarial Perturbations is out now on arxiv. The paper covers the basic terminologies and concepts that build up the subject matter of Adversarial Perturbations and then all the recent literature work to further develop the field. Lastly it also delves into the applications of the same and the future work directions possible in this field.

Checkout the preprint here.
